page.title: 01Presteigne and Lugg valley
page.content: Presteigne is the old county town of Radnorshire,(Powys after 1974)sited on the{English-Welsh border. Offa's Dyke is to the north west.The{River Lugg flows eastwards through the area.Most employment is in{livestock farming, including growth of fodder crops.Tree cover is fairly extensive due to planting of mainly coniferous forest by the{Forestry Commission}and private landowners.The remainder of the population work in the service sector, although many young people have to leave to work in the cities, while senior citizens from those areas buy retirement cottages here.B roads link to neighbouring towns,while a by-pass built with{EEC money}skirts the town along the route of the old {railway}closed in 1964 for goods traffic and for passengers in 1958. Written by E.Hardy
